text: That sounds right! That just helped me out at least with how the structure of this will look. Now Iâ€™m just hitting a roadblock with trying to submit the JSON to the Vidyard Endpoint, so I guess thats something I will talk to them about

If you can't find help over there, feel free to circle back and I'd be happy to see if I could help. I'd need the following:
1. Method of your request (ie GET, POST, PUT, etc)
2. Body of your request (ie the JSON you're sending to VidYard)
3. The HTTP status code for the response you're getting from VidYard (ie 405, 500, etc)
4. The response text (this is the part that will typically indicate why you're getting an error.)
Best of luck!
